page.title: 18Law and Order
page.content: The first question the community police were asked,was what was the peoples reaction to the police in 1985.They told us it was very good after the miners strike.Most of the police live locally,and regulary visit boy's clubs.The nearest court is in Bargoed a town 3 miles up the valley from Pengam.Serious offences are dealt with at Cardiff Crown Court.There are no police dogs kept locally but one could be reached in 15 minutes.There is one main police station at Ystrad Mynach,two miles south of Pengam.More policemen walk the beat than use cars. There is some vandalism,but the biggest problems are burgularies and damage to property.The busiest time is after 11 o'clock on Friday and Saturday nights.There have been few accidents and the impression is that motorists drive fairly well.
